title: Paying well for 3 T207's - lots of sale/trade material, too!
author: frohme

posts.post_title: Paying well for 3 T207's - lots of sale/trade material, too!
posts.post_content:
Thanks to everyone that has help so far - ts been great working with each of you!

Looking for 3 cards to complete a couple mostly dormant T207 projects.  

  * Recruit - Factory 240: Fisher (white cap)
  * Recruit - Factory 606: Livingston "Big C", Thomas

Grade is pretty much unimportant, though I'd prefer the back be readable.

Also looking for a couple tough cards with Broadleaf backs:

Bauman, Bushelman, Butcher

Willing to work strongly in your favor for your help in putting some of these ghosts to rest ...  trade material available includes T207s across the range of difficulties and grades up to PSA 5 and SGC 70, including tough cards:

 Recruit class Block (SGC 20), Engle (SGC 20), Ellis (SGC 30), Hooper (PSA 4), Scott ...
Broadleaf class Adams, Almeida, Benz, Blackburne, Downey (SGC 30), Fournier, Gregg, Hartley, Herzog, Hyatt, Kuhn, Kutina (SGC 50), Moriarty, Phelan, Rasmussen, Saier, Sweeney, O. Wilson (SGC 50)


and other cards that are just tough in this grade:

Barry, Derrick (SGC 70), Tinker, Schulte (SGC 60)

Many [URL="http://imageevent.com/gspinf/forsaletrade"]scans/prices are available[/URL], others yet to come - ask if you don't see something you're looking for - I may have it, but its not up yet. 

Thanks for looking and any help you can offer.

Bump to the top and to say thanks for those that have responded!

2 less on the list, 1 less to upgrade with more activity to go.

Pleased to get responses and interact with good folks, including Mac, Scott, Pete, Andrew, Mike, Brad, and others that I don't recall of the top of my head - very much appreciated.  

--
Mike

I got a wiltse 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Been a few weeks - response has been great, thank you all ... Scott, Pete, Mac, Ron, Andrew - very much appreciated!

Down to just a few left, and have added a bunch of tough cards that are available as trade material! 

Thanks for looking!

--
Mike
